DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder HER2 Positive Breast Carcinoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to biologic subset of breast carcinoma defined by high expression of HER2 by lack of expression of estrogen receptor (ER) therapy as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder HER2 Positive Breast Carcinoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A biologic subset of breast carcinoma defined by high expression of HER2, GRB7, and TRAP100, and by lack of expression of estrogen receptor (ER)._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: HER2 Positive Breast Carcinoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A biologic subset of breast carcinoma defined by high expression of HER2, GRB7, and TRAP100, and by lack of expression of estrogen receptor (ER).:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A biologic subset of breast carcinoma defined by high expression of HER2, GRB7, and TRAP100, and by lack of expression of estrogen receptor (ER).
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have HER2 positi
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have HER2 positive breast cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have positive HER2 test result as defined in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have HER2-positive or HER2-expressing tumors as defined by CLIA-certified labs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have HER2-positive or HER2-expressing tumors determined by a CLIA-certified laboratory?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have HER2-positive or HER2-expressing tumors determined by a CLIA-certified laboratory with the specific requirement of HER2 status outlined by the following: HER2 expression (1-3+) by IHC locally and confirmed centrally OR HER2 expression (1-3+) by IHC tested centrally OR HER2 amplification based on FISH or Next Generation Sequencing?
